attributes.action: No cash transaction after 2025-30
attributes.background:
It would eliminate “black markets” and allow easier monetary policy.
Underground economy in the UK is worth +/- £150bn a year.
It could easily solve problems with the NHS, social housing, investment in research, education etc.
attributes.additional_details:
It would help to “wipe off “ undeclared work and organised crime income.
Cash transactions are less popular each year.
Let’s make the UK a leader and be the first Cashless Nation.

attributes.action: Call on DEFRA to withdraw UK approval of A24 trap, sold in NZ to kill hedgehogs.
attributes.background: DEFRA recently approved the use of these traps in England (pending in Wales & Scotland). The traps(https://www.goodnature.co.nz/pests/#c315) are sold to kill hedgehogs (& other species), in New Zealand where hedgehogs are non-native & considered a ‘pest’ species.
attributes.additional_details: In the UK hedgehogs are protected being listed on Schedule 6 of the Wildlife & Countryside Act. If a trap is set & it catches a hedgehog, then the person who set the trap can be prosecuted. Anyone setting traps for ‘vermin’ or non-protected species is obliged to take all reasonable precautions to avoid catching a protected species, since there are no ‘reasonable precautions’ to avoid catching hedgehogs using this trap, anyone who sets them is at risk of prosecution if they catch a hedgehog.

attributes.action: Amend the Dangerous Wild Animals Act to Exotic and Dangerous Wild Animals Act
attributes.background: Amend the DWA, making it a legal obligation to possess a license for ownership of any wild or non-native species; preventing whimsical buying of animals with specialist care needs to safeguard animal welfare.
attributes.additional_details: Buying without researching care needs of specific animals is especially damaging to reptiles which suffer from ailments, like metabolic bone disease, as a result of improper husbandry. Introducing a license for exotic pet ownership should encourage people buying to understand the commitment they are undertaking, particularly if paired with expert consultation at the time of license purchase. The "EDWA" should also aim to hold accountable those involved in crimes against the Animal Welfare Act.

attributes.action: Amend the new SDLT rules to include new & existing shared ownership home owners
attributes.background: The new SDLT rules announced in the budget allows first time buyers to avoid stamp duty for properties up to £300k. Shared ownership home owners are not due to pay stamp duty until they staircase to above 80% ownership however they are still liable to pay despite it being their first purchase.
attributes.additional_details: Shared ownership home owners can defer the stamp duty payment until over 80% of a property is owned.  Shared ownership is a scheme used by many young adults to try and get onto the property ladder as a first time buyer. Stamp duty should not be payable for those who are shared ownership home owners on their purchase including when they staircase so are in a position where is needs to be paid for the first time. The new rules need to be amended to cover people in this situation.

attributes.action: Make the Monday after Remembrance Sunday a bank holiday.
attributes.background: A lot of people like to travel to the Remembrance Sunday parades. Many of these people are ex-service personnel now working for civilian companies, having the Monday off would allow them to travel to London for example or where they spent much of their service life such as Portsmouth & Plymouth
attributes.additional_details: for the Navy and Aldershot for the Army. They would be able to travel with their families and meet with old comrades and the people who are serving now so they can share memories and stories of old friends who are no longer with us and the places they have been and things they have seen.

attributes.action: Stop penalising long-term partners at 40% when it comes to Inheritance Tax
attributes.background: We believe, in terms of Inheritance Tax, long-term partners are being treated grossly unfairly as opposed to married couples/civil partners.  Like millions of others in this country, long-term partners are equally committed to each other as anyone else and should not be penalised with a 40% tax!
attributes.additional_details: Some12,000,000 people in this country for many personal reasons choose not to marry.  In some cases a previous bad experience in marriage may persuade them not to say "I do" for a second time. Previous correspondence from the Treasury suggested that married couples/civil partners were seen as being in "committed/recognised" relationships.  This is something of an insult to genuine couples who have been together but unmarried for 25+ years. The government must stop this totally unfair prejudice.

attributes.action: Change how pets are seen in law to ensure police/CPS can prosecute
attributes.background: When clear intent is shown to deprive a family or persons of their pet the police should have the framework in place to ensure the CPS can make an informed decision on prosecution, the Theft Act 1968 doesn't outline what is seen as acceptable steps to reunite an owner with their pet.
attributes.additional_details:
We've seen a sharp rise in pet thefts and millions of Britons will agree, pets are more than just property, they are family. 

We the undersigned request that this government takes further steps to protect animals and owners by clearly outlining:

1) What is seen as acceptable steps to reunite owners with their pets. 

We strongly urge the requirement for chips to be checked as soon as an animal is discovered. This step will allow the police to have a clear view of what is seen as acceptable so "intent to deprive" can be formed. 

2) Reconsider the use the term of "property" for pets. 

Legislation regarding animal welfare shows that we do see them as more than possessions.

attributes.action: Every person in the UK to be given a tree to plant to reverse UK deforestation
attributes.background: The UK is believed to be in deforestation (cut down more trees than are planted). This is on top of the UK tree land mass (13%) is far behind other countries, EU (38%), Japan (68%), USA (34%). If every person in the UK were given a tree to plant the UK tree population could dramatically increase

attributes.action: Make it illegal for coaches to transport children with inadequate seatbelts
attributes.background: In 2016 4% of road deaths were children (a). The law states very clearly that "you can be fined up to £500 if a child isn’t in the correct seat while you’re driving" (b).  Yet currently minibuses and coaches are exempt; "the law does not require passengers under 14 years old to wear a seat belt" (c)
attributes.additional_details:
(a) https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/648081/rrcgb2016-01.pdf

(b) https://www.gov.uk/seat-belts-law 

(c) http://www.childcarseats.org.uk/the-law/other-vehicles-buses-coaches-and-minibuses/

attributes.action: Ban use of Automatic Number Plate Recognition unless investigating crime
attributes.background: Since ANPR is by definition, a tool of mass surveillance, requiring no 'probable cause' to investigate the whereabouts of law-abiding citizens, it has no place in a free society.
attributes.additional_details: For the reasons mentioned above, I consider the use of ANPR, for anything other than the investigation of crime, to be an illegal act. It is incompatible with the principles of 'innocent until proven guilty', which has been a cornerstone of British justice for centuries. ANPR has been installed as a 'fait accompli', enabling routine and blanket mass surveillance of the British population. Simply put, unless I am a criminal suspect, it is none of the government's business where I go in my car.

attributes.action: Set a maximum premium level for car insurance.
attributes.background: Since the law requires any driver to be insured, there should be a legal maximum the insurers can charge for the annual premium with a basic cover that is acceptable by law.
attributes.additional_details: The government should ensure that a maximum charge is set giving the basic cover needed by law for full comprehensive and third party. The law requires drivers to be insured, the law should also state the maximum that can be charged for this service.

attributes.action: Government to help Monarch (now in administration)
attributes.background: If the Government could step in and either loan it money or buy it and have Monarch run as a State entity, it could prevent so many job losses and retain happy customers, as well as having an asset.
attributes.additional_details: Monarch had many bookings and customers at the time of its collapse. It has a strong and loyal staff base. This airline can be saved for the good of all.

attributes.action: Create a Government of Shared Unity
attributes.background: Whereby the position of Prime minister is replaced by a parliamentary body consisting of representatives from each party which gained a significant number of votes in the election.
attributes.additional_details: Democracy voted that not one single party should lead Government. To solve issues, and to conclude  Brexit well, Great Britain needs a group of people standing for the best principles from major parties. The needs of Great Britain are large and complex, and can not be resolved by the ideas of one single party. We do not need a dictator; we need a group of passionate people who want to resolve the problems of Great Britain from every aspect-the environment; financially; socially... the list goes on.

attributes.action: Prevent the current changes to pharmacy regulations being debated by the DoH
attributes.background: The planned changes to pharmacy regulations aim to allow a pharmacy to open and allow prescription-only medicines to be given out without a Responsible Pharmacist present. This will inevitably result in both patient harm and reduced access to pharmacy services for patients.
attributes.additional_details: The government has said that they wish to "better utilise the skills of pharmacists in healthcare settings such as hospitals and GP practices", but have put no proposals forward to guarantee jobs for the many community pharmacists and Locums that this will put out of work. People who have been at the heart of the community helping patients will now find themselves without work, and those patients will find they have reduced access to pharmacy services.

attributes.action: Make the Tax-Free Childcare service more transparent for Childcare Providers
attributes.background: There is a complete lack of communication about payments that have been made through Tax-Free Childcare. Providers have an account they can login to, but cannot see any payments that have been made to them.
attributes.additional_details: We rely on parents telling us they have made a payment, and then have to wait until the money is credited to our bank account which can take several working days. We do not get any notification about when a payment is made, and if we call the helpline we are told that information cannot be shared about any pending payments due to data protection. Even on our bank statements, it does not say who the payment has come from. We cannot operate a business like this.

attributes.action: Make Mental Health Awareness Training Mandatory for All Employers and Managers
attributes.background: Mental health problems have a greater impact on people’s ability to work than any other group of disorders. At the moment, we have no mandatory protocol, training or support for people who suffer with Mental Illness and this usually ends in dismissal by a manager or resignation of an employee.
attributes.additional_details: I, as well as thousands of other people in the UK, find it hard to talk out about Mental Health, especially when our Job is concerned. We can’t come to terms with telling our Manager as we fear for our job. People suffering with Depression, Anxiety or any other Mental Health condition should be supported at work. This Petition is to make Employers and Managers carry out the correct training to educate them on what we go through on a daily basis and ways to avoid our conditions spiralling

attributes.action: Invest in gridscale battery storage to stabilise wholesale prices of electricity
attributes.background: Renewable energy supply has succeeded in droping wholesale MW prices into negative but without storage nothing is being done to prevent low supply periods seeing prices hikes as high as £83 per MW as seen in May 2017. A stable grid, means cheaper bills for consumers and a future for energy suppliers
attributes.additional_details: On 11th June 2017 a record 70% of the electricity for the UK’s homes and businesses was low-carbon. Solar cuts the power demand for National Grid, reducing prices, while wind power also lowers prices. When renewable supply drops however wholesale prices are being ramped higher. Prices can fluctuate between less than £0 and as much as £83 per MW as seen in May 2017. Battery storage facilities like the new plant seen in South East Australia would resolve this problem and save the consumer money.

attributes.action: Add red hair colour to the protected characteristics of the Equality Act.
attributes.background: Stop cruel comments with insinuations that being a red head is unfortunate ugly and embarrassing.That a person deserves to be bullied because there a red head.
attributes.additional_details: Taunting red heads seems to be the last socially accepted freebie in society, yet it's impact can be as devastating to the receiver as any person covered in the discrimination act. Abuse ranges from name calling which leads to low self esteem and depression. Most disturbing suicide. Serious assaults have occurred just for being a red head. A red head can't change the colour of hair. Like a person can't change their skin colour, sexual orientation or disability.  It can't continue. It's not "OK".

attributes.action: Campaign for a Festival of Britain 2021 to celebrate 70 years since last one
attributes.background: UK has faced years of austerity - likely to continue up to 2021. This would give the British people a feel-good factor and added  prestige throughout the world, which will promote tourism.  An opportunity for trade and industry visits from other nations to showcase the UK as open for business
attributes.additional_details: Refer to the previous Festival of Britain in 1951 and look at what events occurred from those days and consider an updated version which included London and other provincial cities.   Put into place exhibitions, the provision of a festival ship (which occurred previously to promote British ports and industry).  Ask other major cities to put on events that may be a speciality to that particular region (eg historical interests and future innovations).

attributes.action: Petition for annual increase for pensioners outside the EU Block.
attributes.background: My pension has been deferred for 5 years, by various Governments and now I find, I will not get yearly pension rises, because I am not in an EU country!

attributes.action: Reverse the planned ban on letting agent fees to tenants
attributes.background: The UK Government is currently putting a bill through Parliament to ban letting agents or landlords from charging any fees to tenants for renting a home. This ban will likely put costs to tenants up so we would like to see it reversed before primary legislation is passed as a cap is more appropriate
attributes.additional_details: A ban on fees to tenants will simply push these costs onto landlords who are a long way from all being able to afford them. This will drive up rents and drive down standards and, crucially, reduce supply as landlords are squeezed on top of recent tax changes. Asking prospective tenants to make a reasonable contribution to the vetting process is in no way unreasonable and a cap is a perfectly workable compromise. The Government’s broken housing policy needs private landlords right now.

attributes.action: Hold a Public Inquiry into >45000 extra deaths linked to austerity since 2010
attributes.background: A recent study published in the BMJ showed a correlation between cuts to social and healthcare funding and higher than expected national mortality rates since 2010. A Public Inquiry should be held in order to determine whether Government Austerity measures have led to an increase in death rate.
attributes.additional_details:
Long term under funding of health and social care services has led to widespread suffering, a decline physical and mental health and vulnerable people being put at risk. Lack of funding may also be responsible for >45000 deaths since 2010. If this is the case, harmful government action and policy must be reversed and responsible politicians held to account over these deaths.

Study: http://bmjopen.bmj.com/content/7/11/e017722

attributes.action: Make the 'Too Close for Comfort' scheme compulsory to all police forces
attributes.background:
Ever feel overtaking cars are too close for comfort?

For 2 million people who cycle every day, close passes are a daily occurrence. Close passes are intimidating and account for around a third of all threatening incidents between drivers and cyclists.  There’s a simple way to stop this happening.
attributes.additional_details:
Last September, West Midlands Police sent officers on bikes to educate drivers who overtook cyclists too closely. People who drove too close to the officers were pulled over, then educated on what they had done wrong.

Incredibly, driving behaviour in the local area changed overnight, with a 50 per cent reduction of reported close pass offences in less than three months.

Some police forces have chosen not to partake in the scheme and we feel as if it should be compulsory.

attributes.action: Make national rugby accessible to all to watch
attributes.background:
Home nation rugby should be available to all through live coverage on terrestrial tv channels.
It is absurd that one of our home nation teams playing one of our most popular sports is now only available to those who can afford to, and pre-plan to use subscription television.
attributes.additional_details: How can we be expected to support & celebrate our own nation in a sport in which we are world class when we are unable to watch without subscribing? The move of national sport from terrestrial TV to subscription services is going to gradually quench the ability for supporters to follow their nation & ultimately reduce participation in the sport. Not only will this reduce the passion for our nation but reduce any future prospects for a world leading team when we are at the very peak of the game.

attributes.action: Allow citizens to raise concerns about M.P.s' behaviour during Commons' Debates
attributes.background: M.P.s may raise a Point of Order during a House of Commons’ sitting if they think that an M.P. has said something offensive or inappropriate during a Commons' Debate.  There is no way for members of the public to do this.
attributes.additional_details: Members of the public should be able to raise a matter of concern with the Speaker, who should be required to report it to the House (as was tradition, such as in the case of the Imprisonment for Default of Mr. S. Saklatvala, M.P., in May 1926).

attributes.action: Make voting in local & general elections compulsory.
attributes.background: The 'turn-out' at local government elections is abysmal. The resultant problem is that small groups that are motivated by a covert agenda may succeed. A 'fixed penalty' for failing to vote - as applies in Australia & N.Z. - might provide an extra incentive to vote.
attributes.additional_details: District & County Councillors, School Governors, are being elected by a tiny number of electors. Called upon to administer complex issues & substantial budgets, they may be - at best - incompetent, at worst be driven by a motive contrary to that desired by the majority. The ballot slip should include a box labelled 'none of the above', but anyone on the electoral roll who doesn't vote should have to pay a fixed penalty - say £50. Voting 'on line' should also be possible.

attributes.action: Introduce a 10% maximum limit on a university's intake from independent schools.
attributes.background: 7% of children in Britain go to an independent school. In this age of soaring inequality, the fact that around 40% of offers of a place at Oxbridge, and around 25% from the Russell Group of top universities, go to these students is simply shocking. It is 2017, not 1917. Enough is enough.
attributes.additional_details:
Despite promises from the top universities to improve their systems for admissions, figures released by MP David Lammy, show the situation to be worsening. 82% of offers from Oxford and 81% from Cambridge went to students from the top two socio-economic groups in 2015, up from 79% at both universities five years earlier.* 

The government must act. A withdrawl of public funding, plus significant fines for offending institutions should be implemented immediately.

*The Guardian 19 10 2017

attributes.action: Ban HGV's from using lane 2 between 06:00 to 22:00 hrs on 2 lane highways
attributes.background:
With the introduction of 4 lane smart motorways traffic congestion is worse than ever. HGV's are now actively using lanes 1,2 & 3 restricting every other vehicle to lane 4.

On 2 lane highways they sit side by side for mile after mile unable to pass and holding up other faster moving vehicles.
attributes.additional_details:
1. Between 06:00 and 22:00 hrs no HGV may use lane 2.
2. If the overtaking HGV is unable to pass a slower vehicle in under 90 seconds and safely pull in back in then the move should not be attempted.
3. HGV's must not use lane 3 on "smart" motorways.
4. HGV's up to 7.5 tonnes may not use lane 4 on smart motorways, anyone found doing so should receive 6 penalty points and a £1000 fine. Use of the overhead cameras to identify culprits could be used.

attributes.action: Make child parking legally badge-held spaces only for those with children.
attributes.background: People are using these spaces without children present causing undue stress and danger to those with a child or children present. We are punished for parking illegally in disabled slots. Why is children parking any different...

attributes.action: hold a new general election in 2018
attributes.background: There needs to be an general election in 2018 because no one has the majority in Westminster

attributes.action: Create a non-profit National Public Insurance company.
attributes.background: Insurance prices are very expensive for all drivers, therefore the goverment should look into making a national public insurance organisation which is non profit and which is considerably less in cost.
attributes.additional_details: Having vehicle insurance in compulsory, and by making it so that it must be purchased from a private firm. The organisation must have lower prices than private firms and should have the backing of the government. The goverment should only pay into the organisation till start up, until it is able to sustain itself.

attributes.action: Repeal Restriction of Offensive Weapons Act 1959 amended 1961
attributes.background:
The Restriction of Offensive Weapons Act 1959 (amended in 1961) banned the importation, manufacture, sale, hiring, lending
of knives that are not manually opened by hand, and not locked
in place by hand.

Should the mechanism of a knife should determine it's legality? I don't believe it should.
attributes.additional_details:
Please don't take my word for it, read the sources yourself and please consider another perspective apart from your own. We all benefit from talking

Restriction of Offensive Weapons Act 1959:
http://www.legislation.gov.uk/ukpga/Eliz2/7-8/37

Restriction of Offensive Weapons Act 1961 Amendment:
http://www.legislation.gov.uk/ukpga/Eliz2/9-10/22

"The Toy That Kills" article that started mass hysteria of "flick knives" which are knives that open by the push of a button:
http://bayimg.com/oajmkAagC

attributes.action: Make it unlawful for candidate names to be on UCAS applications.
attributes.background: Racism, sexism and class discrimination exist. Applications to university should be based entirely on the candidate's ability and not prejudice or social engineering. Removing names from UCAS applications, removes another potential way that universities can discriminate.
attributes.additional_details: In 2015, David Cameron stated that this would be introduced. Instead, a few universities have volunteered to trial the removal of names from UCAS applications. It is noted that neither the University of Oxford nor the University of Cambridge are a part of the trial. This is nonsense! There is no reason to allow universities and UCAS to decide whether to keep names on UCAS forms. Instead, this should be government policy and enforced. This is too important to leave to UCAS and their universities to decide for themselves.

attributes.action: Make government condemn the violence of Spain's police against the Catalans
attributes.background: On the day of the Catalonia independence referendum, Spain's national police used batons and rubber bullets to attack people who were peacefully attempting to cast their vote. Approximately 890 Catalans were injured. Let's make our government stand against brutalising peaceful voters.
attributes.additional_details: The response to a peaceful referendum should never be violence, especially not by the police force that should serve and protect the Catalans. The UK foreign ministry has refused to condemn the Spanish authorities. This is unacceptable to me. I therefore would like to express that I and my fellow citizens do condemn the heinous violence of Spain's national police towards their citizens . Hopefully we will be heard.

attributes.action: Allow teenagers aged 14 and above to vote.
attributes.background: The government's decisions today are the foundation of our lives tomorrow. We say that teenagers aged 14 and above should also get a vote as it's their futures which are affected by government decisions.
attributes.additional_details: Some may argue that young adults under the age of 18 are not responsible enough to be allowed to vote, however, up until now it's always been the adults voting, and as you can see, the world is not in a great political state. They also have a right to have a say in their OWN futures. This is not something to think about, it's an obvious and fundamental change which is extremely vital to children's human rights and needs to happen.

attributes.action: Urge the British Government to recognise the Armenian tragedy as a genocide
attributes.background: I believe that my country was a beacon of hope and righteousness (being a descendant of holocaust survivors), but knowing that this is such an injustice has made me feel so utterly depressed that I no longer feel pride for my country, as it takes trade deals with Turkey over British moral principles
attributes.additional_details: https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/359550/FOI_ref_0298-14_Attachment_29.pdf

attributes.action: Install ANPR systems on the A2 junction with the A282.
attributes.background: Drivers bypass the A282 by using the A2 junction roundabout and then the A225 junction when the traffic is bad. This causes severe delays to Dartford residents going about their daily business. Drivers doing this show no consideration to other drivers and they should be fined for using this dodge.
attributes.additional_details: I live in DA1 and it once took 45 minutes to get to Asda Greenhithe because of this level of inconsiderate driving. Yesterday it accounted for nearly 20 minutes of delay because of HGV drivers blocking the A225 Princes Road junction with the roundabout. Local residents have the right to go about their daily business without the fear of being delayed by such inconsiderate drivers, who are only interested in themselves. Plus there are frequent law infringements on this roundabout.

attributes.action: Increase efficiency of motorways by permitting overtaking on the left.
attributes.background: The UK motorway network is one of the most congested in Europe. The UK government are spending £ millions implementing "smart motorways" to help increase efficiency. The problem is NOT just volume of traffic, but because motorists don't abide by Highway code rule 264 leading to 'empty lanes'.
attributes.additional_details: Penalties to motorists ignoring rule 264 (keeping in the left lane unless overtaking) were introduced, but the decrease in motorway police patrols means this rarely enforced. Many motorists still habitually drive in Lane 2 while Lane 1 is empty;this forces all faster moving traffic into Lane 3 so becomes full 'nose to tail' and motorways operate below optimum capacity. By allowing overtaking on the left (as the USA) ALL lanes of motorways would be fully utilised to increase capacity at no cost.

attributes.action: Don't put down Army dogs because they can't be re-homed. We owe a duty of care
attributes.background:
Two hero Army dogs which helped save thousands of lives on duty in Afghanistan are to be put down because they can't be re-homed, it has been reported.
Ex soldiers and dog handlers who worked with the Belgian Shepherds are said to have written to a Defence chief demanding the decision be reversed.
attributes.additional_details:
“This is such a cruel way to treat these animals that have given us so much.
“People who worked closely with these dogs are devastated at the plans — they’ve begged to save them all.
"Experienced handlers have come forward to say they want to house the much-loved dogs, who have helped save hundreds of lives. 
In 2012, The Mirror reported how 807 of our much-loved military dogs had been destroyed by the Army over the past decade despite years of faithful service.
Daily Mirror online 1/12.17

attributes.action: Make Puppy farming a criminal offence
attributes.background: A puppy farmer is a breeder who breeds puppies with little or no regard for the health and welfare of the puppies or their parents. Once the puppies are born, they are separated from their mothers at 4 weeks old. After, the bitches are given dangerous injections for them to go back into heat
attributes.additional_details:
Health of puppies sold by puppy farmers:
20% of puppies (four times more than the average) bought from pet shops or directly from the internet suffer from parvovirus, an often fatal disease which can cost up to £4,000 to treat (2014 Kennel Club PAW survey).

With no regulations, puppy mills have no cleanup control. This means that dogs can be living in urine and feces for indefinite periods of time.

Puppy mills have no veterinary care, climate control, or protection for the animals from weather

attributes.action: Science is compulsory at GCSE. Make it an option.
attributes.background: Help young secondary students realise their potential and stop the stigma around academic subjects being "more necessary. "
attributes.additional_details: As a society we have advanced enough for there to be jobs in a variety of different industries. There are opportunities to go down career paths besides a scientific one. Creativity and individuality should be something we teach the youth of today, it's dissapointing that the education system has rules set in place that make students feel they aren't clever enough just because they are not as academically gifted as others. Science is compulsory, but wouldn't it seem wrong if Drama or Art was made compulsory at GCSE? Students are not shunned for "lack of creativity" so why should it be the other way around? Please sign this petition so the government may consider debating this.

attributes.action: Stop the UK goverment from giving more than £20 billion to the EU.
attributes.background: Looking at net figures Britain has consistently paid billions of pounds to the EU usually only Germany contributing more. We have given so much over the years to help other EU members but with public services now struggling to meet the demands put on them it is time to put our own people first.

attributes.action: Provide free broadband to every UK home
attributes.background: Broadband is a necessity in today's world and should therefore be accessible to all, much like fresh running water and electricity. Surely if every house was provided with broadband through a nationalised BT Openreach, it would be more cost effective than each person arranging their own.
attributes.additional_details: The infrastructure already exists to provide every home in the UK with free broadband and would not be an expensive project. BT Openreach have an undeserved monopoly in this market and should be nationalised to provide this public service. The minimal cost could be added to our council tax bills and would be a lot less than most homes currently pay for broadband. Like most public services those less able to pay, would pay less through means tested lower council tax bills but all would benefit

attributes.action: Teach LGBTQ sexual education in schools and about other sexuality's.
attributes.background: Within schools teaching LGBTQ sexual education is not on the curriculum, leaving those who are homosexual without the correct education that they need to have healthy and positive sexual experiences, with many contracting diseases. The spectrum of sexuality's are also left open for stereotyping.
attributes.additional_details:
The GLSEN 2013 National School Climate Survey found that fewer than five percent of LGBT students had health classes that included positive representations of LGBTQ topics.

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-33237995-for facts on sexually transmitted diseases for men

https://www.mentalhealth.org.uk/a-to-z/s/sexuality-for how mental health affects those on the spectrum.

attributes.action: Make feminine hygiene products free for women.
attributes.background: How much money do we need to spend on something we can't help but need? Condoms are free from clinics, why shouldn't sanitary towels and tampons be? It's a disgrace and it needs addressing! We can't keep ignoring it. It's real and it's wrong.
attributes.additional_details: We shouldn't be paying for something our bodies need. It's a disgrace. I'm sure no woman on the planet likes the menstrual cycle. It should be free. We need to address this and actually do something about it. Stop ignoring it and accepting it - it's WRONG. It would be free if it were men that needed them. We need to fight this!

attributes.action: Ban all plastic shopping bags and instead only sell reusable shopping bags.
attributes.background: The impact of plastic bags on the environment is enormous. ... Approximately 100,000 sea turtles and other marine animals die every year because they either mistake the bags for food or get strangled in them, says Natural.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2017/nov/03/dramatic-rise-in-plastic-seabed-litter-around-uk
https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/greenerideal.com/news/environment/0613-how-do-plastic-bags-affect-our-environment/amp/

attributes.action: Same sex married couples should be able to divorce on grounds of adultery
attributes.background: When the UK Government welcomed same sex marriage and updated the Marriage Act accordingly, they neglected to sufficiently update the divorce law. We are now living in a country where same sex couples cannot divorce under the grounds of adultery. Where is the equality? Equal rights for all.
attributes.additional_details: Adultery is not legally recognised as grounds for marriage dissolution in the UK. The message this sends out is that the laws will selectively discriminate. It also shows a lack of foresight and planning - always check your dependencies (cause and effect of law changes).

attributes.action: Firms that offer tax avoidance services should not win public sector contracts
attributes.background: As seen in the 'Panama' and 'Paradise' papers, wealthy clients use the services of lawyers and accountants to legally minimise tax obligations. Farcically, the major accounting/consulting firms often support the Government in drafting the same tax legislation they subsequently help clients avoid.

attributes.action: Stop companies from draining UK taxable profits and cap ‘Earnings Stripping’

attributes.action: Hold a referendum on switching the British election system over to MMP
attributes.background: The British FPTP election system has lead to an unproportional Parliament not representing the wants of the British people with parties being able to get a majority with just 30 precent of the vote.
attributes.additional_details:
The British people have never voted on a truly proportional voting system with AV being heavily flawed and with the referendum in question having a turn out of just 40% many voters wanted something else. MMP keeps constituencies and thus the constituent link.
